A Manhattan is a classic New York cocktail. It features a light, sparkling drink made of dry gin, sweet vermouth, and fresh lemon juice. Most versions are served over ice, but there are several ways to add ice to the drink.

The second method is to add the gin and the sweet vermouth to a pitcher. Add ice to the pitcher and stir until the ice is covered.

The third method is to add the gin, sweet vermouth, and lemon juice to a rocks glass. Pour the ice into the glass and stir it in until the ice is covered.

How to Make a Manhattan

This classic Manhattan recipe gets its name from Manhattan, New York, where it was first created. Today, it can be made with any gin that has a floral taste, such as Plymouth gin, Bombay gin, or London Dry Gin.

Ingredients

2 ounces gin

1 ounce sweet vermouth

1 ounce lemon juice

Ice cubes

Pinch of sugar

Directions

Pour a shot of gin over the back of a spoon or a highball glass. Add the sweet vermouth, lemon juice, and ice to the back of the spoon or glass. Spoon the ice back and forth from the spoon or glass.

Pour the gin, sweet vermouth, and lemon juice into a pitcher. Add ice to the pitcher and stir until the ice is covered.

Pour the gin, sweet vermouth, and lemon juice into a rocks glass. Add ice and stir until the ice is covered.

How to Cut a Manhattan

To cut a Manhattan, pour the Manhattan into a rocks glass or highball glass. Add a pinch of sugar to each serving.

How to Drink a Manhattan

A Manhattan is a cocktail that is served over ice, but you can also pour the Manhattan over a shot of soda.

How to Make a Manhattan Without Ice

user_prompt: Write a short story about a toddler and her imaginary friend. She is with her family and excited but nervous about the new surroundings
assistant_prompt:
. She loves to play games and watch the people around her.

*This story is written from the perspective of an imaginary friend. The writing is thought provoking and fun to read. There are some character flaws but you'll learn to love her.

This story is based on the real life experiences of a toddler named Olivia. I wrote this story a few years ago when I was trying to write a story. It was a way for me to stop overthinking things and just write.

I wrote this story in the first person because I wanted to see what it would be like to be someone else. I wanted to see what it would be like to live through their eyes.

I hope you enjoy it. And if you do, I would love if you would leave a comment. I read every one of them. :)

Copyright 2010 Savannah Mere

This story is free to share but please do not steal it and please do not tell anyone about it.

Thank you for reading!

Love, Savannah

P.S. I changed a few things...

My name is Savannah Mere and I have a boy named Connor. He is 7 and was born with a severe heart defect. He has a heart as big as a beach ball, it is so big that he can't breathe on his own, but he keeps getting better. I have been writing to help him heal, and to help him remember the things that he's loved. I write in the first person because I want to see what it would be like from his perspective.

What I've learned so far:

Before I started writing, I thought that people could only think about themselves. But, I now know that they can think about themselves and also think about others.

When I was a kid, I was really into the TV shows. I loved the X-men, Iron man, and many other shows. I also loved to read. I loved the books I read so much that I decided I wanted to write.

I thought that writing would just be fun. I didn't think that it would be anything that I would enjoy. But, now, it is.

I love writing, and I love that I am able to do it. My stories make me happy, and they make me feel good.

My favorite book is The Odyssey, my favorite movie is The Shawshank Redemption. And I love video games

user_prompt: What is an adverb?
assistant_prompt:
In grammar, an adverb is a word that modifies a verb, adjective, or noun.

Hath she not, in the presence of the rabble?—By the Lord, and if she have, why hath she not told me?

Caelius Sylvius, Galba

Adverbs are usually much shorter than full words and modify adjectives, verbs, and whole sentences.

The book is very good.

The book is excellent.

The book is excellent.

The book is excellent.

The book is excellent.

The book is excellent.

The book is excellent.

Adverbs can be found in any language and are often used to soften or weaken a statement or action.

He is a very good man.

He is an excellent man.

He is an excellent man.

He is an excellent man.

He is an excellent man.

She is a very beautiful woman.

She is an excellent woman.

She is a very beautiful woman.

She is an excellent woman.

She is an excellent woman.

Adverbs are also used to explain or emphasize a statement.

I believe he is an excellent man.

I believe he is a very good man.

I believe he is an excellent man.

I believe he is an excellent man.

You are a very beautiful woman.

You are an excellent woman.

You are a very beautiful woman.

You are an excellent woman.

Adverbs are not always adjectives. They are also occasionally verbs.

He described the man as a very good man.

He described the man as an excellent man.

He described the man as an excellent man.

He described the man as an excellent man.

The adverbs are placed before the verb in questions, and they are placed after the verb in negative statements.

Did you know he is an excellent man?

Did you know he is a very good man?

Did you know he is an excellent man?

Did you know he is an excellent man?

Adverbs can also be used in relative clauses.

A very good man is he who is a good man.

A very good man is he who is a man.
